title: Saudi energy minister defends US shale producers: 'They are creating jobs'
author: Matt Clinch
points: ["The U.S. is now the world's largest oil producer hitting 12.3 million b/d in 2019, according to the U.S. Energy Information Administration, up from 11 million b/d in 2018. title: 'Is this the beginning of the end?': OPEC discord raises questions about its long-term future
author: Sam Meredith
points: ['It was initially unclear whether  OPEC members had secured a deal on Thursday, following an acrimonious meeting that ran late into the evening.', 'Herman Wang, OPEC and Middle East specialist at S&P Global Platts, said the meeting had caused him to question the long-term future of OPEC.', 'Speaking to CNBC\'s Dan Murphy in Vienna on Friday, Wang said: "What we saw last night was not a unified OPEC. Is this the beginning of the end?"']

title: OPEC and its allies agree to deepen oil production cuts
author: Sam Meredith
points: ['The new deal, which is much larger than many analysts had expected, will see OPEC+ reduce total oil output by 1.7 million b/d.', "Saudi Arabia's Energy Minister Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman\xa0explained his country would also extend a voluntary cut of 400,000 b/d. ", "This means the energy alliance's total cuts would effectively amount to 2.1 million b/d, he said.", 'The energy alliance has said it plans to review the policy at a meeting on March 5-6.']

title: Saudi minister looks to make his mark as OPEC meeting gets underway
author: Hadley Gamble
points: ['With current cuts set to expire in March, sources told Reuters that a new deal could be extended to June or until the end of 2020. ', 'Key to any deal will be the ability to get all members on side, including Russia.']

title: Saudi Arabia denies pushing OPEC allies to commit to a deeper round of production cuts, source says
author: Sam Meredith
points: ['The oil-rich kingdom was widely considered to be pushing for other OPEC members to sign up for at least an additional 400,000 barrels per day of production cuts on Thursday. ', 'But, one anonymous Saudi oil official told CNBC on the sidelines of a meeting in Vienna, Austria that this was not the case — and Riyadh had not proposed any figures.', 'OPEC and non-OPEC allies — sometimes referred to as OPEC+ — have gathered in Vienna this week to discuss the next phase of their oil production policy.']

title: OPEC meeting ends with market expecting deep production cut
author: Holly Ellyatt
points: ['Global oil-producing group OPEC reportedly considered cutting production by an additional 500,000 barrels per day as its biannual meeting kicked off Thursday in Vienna.', 'The reported 500,000 cut is larger than the numbers floated ahead of the meeting. It would bring the total production cut to 1.7 million barrels per day.', 'On Friday, OPEC and its allies — known as OPEC+ and which includes Russia — will meet to finalize any proposed measures, including how any cuts would be implemented by each country.']

title: Everything you need to watch out for at this week's OPEC+ meeting
author: Sam Meredith
points: ['OPEC members will host a meeting in Vienna, Austria, on Thursday to discuss the next phase of their oil production policy.', 'The 14-member group will then hold talks with non-OPEC allies on Friday.', '"I think there is a possibility that we see around 400,000 barrels per day deeper cuts," Amrita Sen, chief oil analyst at Energy Aspects, told CNBC\'s Dan Murphy in Vienna on Wednesday.']

title: Russia opens Siberian pipeline to China as Beijing expands its influence in the Arctic
author: Grace Shao
points: ['The pipeline comes after China unveiled a plan nearly two years ago called the "Polar Silk Road," expanding its campaign for influence to the Arctic.', 'The resource-rich region is at the heart of the geopolitical battle and struggle for influence.', "As Moscow's relationship with Western countries becomes more frail, Russian business leaders look for more economic opportunities with China, especially in energy."]

title: Repsol says it will reach zero emissions by 2050
author: Pippa Stevens
points: ['Spain-based Repsol said on Monday that it will be carbon neutral by 2050.', 'The company said changes to its oil operations — including shifting the upstream focus to value creation rather than volume, and integrating renewable energy into its refining operations — as well as an increase in its alternative energy portfolio will help the company reach zero emissions.', '"We are convinced that we must set more ambitious objectives to fight climate change," Repsol CEO Josu Jon Imaz said in a statement. "We are convinced that this strengthens our project that is sustainable, attractive and profitable for all our stakeholders."']

title: Natural gas is one of the few trades that hasn't worked on Wall Street, down 50% in 12 months
author: Pippa Stevens
points: ['Natural gas prices fell to a one-month low on Friday, and are currently nearly 50% below where they traded a year ago.', 'Warmer temperatures and record production levels have led to oversupply concerns.', 'The "recent dip in prices may have run its course," KKM Financial\'s Jeff Kilburg said. "I believe you have to respect the range and view the recent selling action as a Black Friday sale for Nat Gas," he added.', 'Longer-term Bespoke Weather chief meteorologist Brian Lovern said that if warmer temperatures continue prices could plunge below the $2.00 level.']

title: Mercedes-Benz US chief says word of mouth the best way to sell electric vehicles
author: Kevin Stankiewicz
points: ['Mercedes-Benz USA CEO Nicholas Speeks says electric vehicles will grow in popularity as more people talk about their positive experiences with them.', 'Manufacturers also need to make quality cars that people want to drive, Speeks tells CNBC.', '"So you have the advantage for yourself in terms of performance but also you have the advantage of benefiting the environment around us," Speeks says.\xa0']

title: Russia's Putin says shale oil technologies are 'barbaric'

title: Oil price will have a 'significant influence' on Russia's growth story, wealth fund chief says
author: Holly Ellyatt
points: ['Oil prices will have a major impact on the direction that the Russian economy will take, according to the chief executive of the Russian Direct Investment Fund (RDIF).', 'He said the alliance or Russia and major oil producer group OPEC (known as OPEC+) is "ready to act" if necessary, however.', '"We\'re quite optimistic about the Russian market going forward," Kirill Dmitriev, CEO of Russia\'s sovereign wealth fund RDIF, told CNBC.']

title: Growth in global oil demand more than doubled in the third quarter, IEA reveals
author: Elliot Smith
points: ["China was the largest contributor, with demand increasing by 640,000 barrels a day year-on-year, and the energy agency's closely-watched report projected a year-on-year acceleration in global growth of 1.9 million barrels per day for the final quarter of 2019.", 'The IEA said the latest figures highlighted the "increasing disparity between the calm oil market of today and heightened geopolitical tensions."']

title: Turkey's behavior is 'deeply concerning' but we need patience with them: ex-CIA chief
author: Natasha Turak
points: ['"This is a sensitive time in the relationship not just between Turkey and the U.S. but Turkey and its NATO partners writ large," General David Petraeus told CNBC.', "Turkey's Incirlik airbase houses an estimated 50 U.S. nuclear bombs and 5,000 American military personnel.", 'Petraeus\' comments come as Trump hosts Turkish President Recep Erdogan in Washington, a visit many U.S. lawmakers have called "shameful" in the wake of Turkey\'s invasion of Northeastern Syria.\xa0']

title: Who's winning Trump's China trade war? Shipping containers tell the real story
author: Lori Ann LaRocco
points: ['President Trump announced a month ago that his administration had clinched a "phase one" trade deal with China. The only way to shovel away the pile of broken promises and contradictory comments is to analyze the flow of maritime trade.']

title: OPEC's Barkindo: Shale producers are concerned that their slowdown is becoming a 'fast deceleration'

title: The ball is in Iran's court on talks, senior US energy official says

title: Global governments 'still coming to terms' with America's energy abundance, official says
author: Holly Ellyatt

title: Oil is a 'broken barometer' and 'lagging indicator' of Middle East tensions, energy expert says

title: Saudi Aramco will offer less than 1% of shares to individual investors in IPO

title: UAE announces Middle East defense giant in the wake of Aramco attacks
author: David Reid
points: ['The UAE has announced the formation of a new defense giant in the Middle East.', 'Edge will be headed by the former managing director at UAE cybersecurity company DarkMatter.', 'It is a combination of 25 state and private firms and will look to tackle cyber and drone threats.']

title: OPEC lowers forecast for oil demand growth, says its own market share is dwindling
author: Sam Meredith
points: ['In its closely-watched annual World Oil Outlook (WOO), the Middle East-dominated producer group said Tuesday that the last 12 months had been "challenging" for energy markets once again.', 'OPEC has lowered its outlook numbers for global oil demand growth, to 104.8 million barrels per day (b/d) by 2024, and 110.6 million b/d by 2040.', '"At the global level, growth is forecast to slow from a level of 1.4 million b/d in 2018 to around 0.5 million b/d towards the end of the next decade," OPEC said in the report.']

title: 4 reasons why analysts are cautious on Saudi Aramco's IPO
author: Holly Ellyatt
points: ['Saudi Aramco may have finally fired the starting pistol on its initial public offering (IPO), but some analysts still believe investors should think carefully before jumping on board.', "The company, the most profitable in the world, announced Sunday that it's planning to list on its local stock market, the Tadawul, in December.", 'But a lack of details on the listing, which eventually could be the largest on record, has left some analysts cold. ']

title: The IMF thinks this small South American country will see economic growth of 86% next year
author: Sam Meredith

title: US and OPEC supply has 'extinguished' any remaining upside potential for oil prices, analyst says
author: Sam Meredith
points: ['U.S. oil production surged by almost 600,000 barrels per day (bpd) in August, government data published Thursday showed, hitting a record of 12.4 million. ', 'Meanwhile, a Reuters survey on OPEC production showed production rose by 690,000 bpd in October. ', '"This latest ramp up in OPEC and U.S. supply extinguished any remaining pockets of upside potential," Stephen Brennock, oil analyst at PVM Oil Associates, said in a research note published Friday.']

title: Ex-California governor predicts state can turn around wildfire crisis in less than two years
author: Jessica Bursztynsky
points: ["Former California Gov. Gray Davis says the state can turn around its wildfire crisis in the next 18 months if it does the work that's needed.", 'Technology should play a major part to help "keep people from the horror of, not only of blackouts, but of planned blackouts, presumably to stop more wildfires," the\xa0Democrat says.', 'Wildfires have been ravaging California  for the past week and utilities have been cutting power to prevent downed lines from starting more fires. ']

title: A contentious Russian-led gas pipeline in Europe will soon exist — Here's why it matters
author: Sam Meredith
points: ["Denmark's energy agency announced Wednesday that it had given the green light to allow Nord Stream 2\xa0to build its pipes in Danish waters.", 'The decision comes as a blow to U.S. efforts to prevent the completion of the Russian-led project, after repeated warnings it will increase European dependence on Russian energy.', '"I would be surprised if the U.S. does not roll out sanctions on things related to Nord Stream as they are eager to get a foothold in the European gas market via LNG,"\xa0Timothy Ash, senior emerging markets strategist at Bluebay Asset Management, said in a research note.']

title: Shell's third-quarter profits fall 15%, launches next phase of its share buyback program
author: Sam Meredith
points: ['Net income attributable to shareholders on a current cost of supplies (CCS) basis, used as a proxy for net profit, and excluding identified items, came in at $4.767 billion for the third quarter of 2019. ', 'That compared with a profit of $5.624 billion in the same quarter a year ago and $3.462 billion in the second quarter.', 'Shares of the Anglo-Dutch oil company are down more than 1% when compared to the same period in 2018.']

title: A global shipping revolution is weeks away — Here are the likely winners and losers
author: Sam Meredith
points: ["On January 1, 2020, the International Maritime Organization (IMO) will impose new emissions standards designed to significantly curb pollution produced by the world's ships.", "For some of the world's biggest oil producers, the new rules coming into force represent a source of great concern.", "Maritime transport is critical to the global economy, with more than 90% of the world's trade carried by sea, according to the United Nations (UN)."]

title: Silicon Valley congressman: California should take control of PG&E as wildfire blackouts persist
author: Jessica Bursztynsky
points: ['"I would have them as a public utility," says\xa0California Rep. Ro Khanna,\xa0a Democrat whose district spans Silicon Valley.', '"When you have a state that has Apple, Google and Tesla in it, there is no excuse that we can\'t get power to our people on a regular basis," says\xa0Khanna.', 'PG&E was switching power off again Tuesday\xa0— this time, to about 1.5 million people in 29 Northern California counties — as wildfires ravage parts of the state. ']

title: BP's third-quarter net profit tumbles 41% on weaker oil prices, weather impacts
author: Sam Meredith
points: ['U.K.-based BP posted third-quarter underlying replacement cost profit, used as a proxy for net profit, of $2.3 billion, versus $2 billion, according to data from Refinitiv. ', 'That compared with a profit of $3.8 billion over the same period a year earlier and $2.8 billion in the second quarter of 2019.', 'The report comes shortly after CEO Bob Dudley, who has worked with BP for 40 years and held the position of CEO for almost a decade, announced he would be soon be stepping down from his role.']

title: Rick Perry says US energy production in a 'substantially better position' than a decade ago
author: Sam Meredith
points: ['In a farewell speech to Energy Department employees last week, Rick Perry claimed the U.S. had "achieved the magnificent goal of energy independence."', 'His comments contrasted with data published by the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA).', 'Perry told CNBC on Saturday that he would leave his post on December 1, with deputy energy secretary Dan Brouillette poised to take the reins.']

title: SEC 'determined to leave public in the dark' on climate change, Sierra Club alleges in suit
author: Eric Rosenbaum
points: ['The Sierra Club scored a win over the Environmental Protection Agency when it failed to produce documents under a FOIA request relating to former Trump EPA head Scott Pruitt.', 'The Securities and Exchange Commission has provided companies with an increasing number of no-action letters, including Exxon Mobil and EOG Resources, allowing the companies to block shareholder resolutions related to climate change.', 'The SEC told the Sierra Club its Freedom of Information Act request would take a least three years to review, leading the environmental group to file a lawsuit.']

title: Goldman Sachs says oil prices are going nowhere next year
author: Sam Meredith
points: ['The U.S. investment bank said Brent crude futures had been caught between "worsening growth expectations and rising Middle East tensions" in recent weeks.', 'But, despite apparent apathy in energy markets, the bank anticipated improving fundamentals would lead to higher prices over the coming months.', '"The ongoing OPEC cuts and slowing shale activity will offset rising other non-OPEC supply and moderate demand growth next year," analysts at Goldman Sachs said.']

title: We finally know what caused the refinery blast that rocked Philadelphia
author: Pippa Stevens
points: ['The June 21 blaze at a Philadelphia refinery was likely caused by a faulty pipe, according to a preliminary report from the U.S. Chemical Safety and Hazard Investigation Board.', 'The explosion released more than 5,000 pounds of deadly hydrofluoric acid into the air.', 'The refinery closed shortly after the fire, and\xa0Philadelphia Energy Solutions filed for bankruptcy in July.']

title: Activists thought BlackRock, Vanguard found religion on climate change. Not anymore
author: Eric Rosenbaum
points: ['BlackRock and Vanguard voted in 2017 to require Exxon Mobil to produce a climate change report.', 'At the time many thought it would prove to be a major milestone in investor-led climate efforts, but the two giant money managers have voted in favor of few similar resolutions since.', '"We thought they had gotten religion on climate change," said one climate investor. "That was a generous interpretation."']

title: Oil prices jump more than 2% after Iran says two missiles struck one of its tankers
author: Matt Clinch
points: ['Brent crude futures were up 2.4% with West Texas Intermediate (WTI) futures showing similar gains.', 'The officials said that the tanker had been traveling through the Red Sea off the coast of Saudi Arabia.', 'Saudi officials were not immediately available to respond to requests for comment, according to Reuters.']

title: OPEC cuts oil demand growth forecast for a third consecutive month
author: Sam Meredith
points: ['In a closely-watched monthly report, OPEC cut its forecast for global oil demand growth for the remainder of this year to 0.98 million barrels per day (b/d). ', "That's down 40,000 b/d from its September estimate.", 'The report comes as the U.S.-China trade war continues to cloud prospects for the global economy and fuel demand.']

title: Michael Bloomberg's $500 million plan to halt the growth of gas is 'irresponsible,' BP boss says
author: Sam Meredith
points: ['In June, Michael Bloomberg, the former mayor of New York City, said that he would donate $500 million to a co-ordinated campaign called "Beyond Carbon."', 'The campaign, according to its website,  is designed to get the U.S. "on the path to a 100% clean energy economy." ', 'In doing so, it plans to prevent the growth of natural gas and close every coal-fired power plant in the U.S.']

title: Saudi Aramco says full oil production capacity will return by end of November
author: Natasha Turak
points: ['The CEO of the world\'s largest oil company expressed his concern over an "absence of international resolve" against the perpetrators of September 14  attacks on Aramco facilities that forced the company to shut down half of its production.']

title: 'Huge fears' about demand are weighing on oil markets, RBC Capital's Helima Croft says
author: Holly Ellyatt
points: ['Oil prices fell for a third consecutive day Wednesday amid a renewal of tensions between Washington and Beijing. ', "This comes ahead of a resumption of talks between the world's two largest economies, set for Thursday. ", 'Benchmark Brent crude futures were trading at $58.09 per barrel Wednesday morning, while U.S. West Texas Intermediate (WTI) was trading at $52.49 per barrel.']

title: Aramco IPO prospectus expected to be filed by end of the month, report says
author: Ganesh Setty
points: ["Saudi Aramco, the world's biggest oil company, is expected to file its IPO prospectus by the end of the month.", "The Aramco IPO was delayed in 2018, reportedly over Saudi officials' concerns about public scrutiny of the company's finances."]

title: Evolution or revolution? BP's incoming CEO tasked with navigating energy transition
author: Sam Meredith
points: ['The U.K.-based oil and gas major announced Friday that Dudley, who has worked with BP for 40 years and held the position of CEO for almost a decade, will be replaced by Bernard Looney on February 5, 2020.', 'Looney, 49, will continue with his current role until February 5, at which point he will take the reins from Dudley and join the BP board.', 'Shares of BP had risen by more than 1% by early Friday afternoon.']

title: BP CEO Bob Dudley to step down, Bernard Looney will succeed
author: Sam Meredith
points: ["Dudley, who has worked with BP for 40 years and held the position of CEO for almost a decade, will be replaced by BP's current upstream chief executive, Bernard Looney.", "The FTSE 100 giant said in a press release that Dudley, who is 64 years old, had decided to step down from his role following the delivery of the firm's 2019 full-year results on February 4, 2020. ", 'He will then retire on March 31 later that year.']

title: Russia can help India to be less dependent on oil, says Indian energy minister
author: Yen Nee Lee
points: ['India and Russia last month announced several deals relating to the energy sector.', "Those deals could help India, the world's third-largest oil consumer and importer, to reduce its reliance on oil, said Indian Minister of Petroleum and Natural Gas Dharmendra Pradhan.", "Diversifying India's energy mix allows the government to better manage its finances, according to Pradhan, who's also the country's steel minister. "]

title: Putin condemns Saudi oil attacks but defends Iran
author: Holly Ellyatt
points: ['Russian President Vladimir Putin condemned attacks on Saudi Arabian oil infrastructure last month.', 'But he defended Iran, saying there is no proof it was behind the attacks — as had been suggested by the U.S. and Saudi Arabia.', '"We condemn such acts no matter who is behind (them) it is a destructive event that had a toll on the whole global energy market," Putin said.']

title: Russian energy minister ridicules Rick Perry's idea of US 'freedom gas'
author: Sam Meredith
points: ['Novak said Wednesday that when it comes to exporting LNG to Europe, Washington did not appear to be prepared to allow for the development of market competition.', 'He also criticized the U.S. for considering sanctions on companies and individuals involved in building the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline project linking Russia to Germany via the Baltic Sea.', 'The U.S. Department of Energy was not immediately available for comment when contacted by CNBC Wednesday morning.']

title: Iran's oil minister dismisses tensions over Aramco attack; says Saudi energy minister is a 'friend'
author: Holly Ellyatt
points: ["Geopolitical tensions between Iran and Saudi Arabia might be the biggest issue facing the Middle East right now but Iran's oil minister has insisted he has a good rapport with his Saudi Arabian counterpart.", '"Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman (Saudi Arabia\'s new energy minister) has been a friend for over 22 years," Iranian oil minister Bijan Zanganeh told an energy conference in Moscow on Wednesday.', 'Tensions are high between the countries following a missile and drone attack on two Saudi Arabian oil facilities in September.']

title: There are 'black swans' all around us, Russia's Energy Minister Novak warns
author: Holly Ellyatt
points: ['"The situation is quite difficult," Novak said at a Russia Energy Week event in Moscow when assessing the outlook for oil markets.', 'A black swan event is often described as an unforeseen event that may have a damaging consequences.\xa0', 'Novak gave an example of demand growth over the summer not being as expected, making the demand outlook for the winter harder to predict.']

title: First US steel plants powered by wind, solar, are coming for industry with big carbon footprint
author: Jacob Douglas
points: ["Nucor's $250 million micromill in Sedalia, Missouri, is set to be the first U.S. steel plant to run on wind energy.", 'A recycled steel plant run by EVRAZ in Colorado is transitioning from coal to solar in a partnership with Xcel Energy and a solar developer half owned by BP.', "Although recycled steel plants run by renewables can make a dent in the industry's carbon footprint, steel contributes as much as 6% to 7% of total greenhouse gas emissions."]

author: Michael Wayland

points: ['Fatih Birol was speaking to CNBC after the IEA launched its World Energy Outlook 2019 report.', 'The landmark Paris Agreement suffered a setback earlier this month when the U.S. began the process to withdraw from it.\xa0']

title: European e-scooter firm Voi bags $85 million in fresh funding round
author: Ryan Browne
points: ["Sweden's Voi Technology says it hopes the fresh fundraising will help it reach profitability.", 'The firm plans to invest in its kick scooters and fund development of its software.', 'Since launching last year, Voi has\xa0lured in 4 million users who have taken 14 million rides.']

title: The demise of the car key: Tesla, Lincoln lead auto industry in ditching keys for mobile entry
author: Michael Wayland
points: [' Key fobs and emerging virtual, or digital, keys are increasingly making traditional metal car keys obsolete.', 'Edmunds reports 91% of\xa02019 model-year vehicles have keyless ignitions to start the vehicle as standard or optional equipment.', 'Tesla was the first to ditch traditional keys and fobs for its Model 3, followed by a similar app-based system by Lincoln.']

title: McDonald's signs 'long term' deals for Texas wind and solar energy
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ["McDonald's joins a number of major U.S. firms signing renewable energy deals.", 'The fast food giant describes the agreements as being "long term" and "large scale." ']

title: Heineken UK to scrap plastic packaging for its multi-pack beers
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ["In recent years, U.K. consumers' awareness of plastic pollution and the damage it can cause has grown.\xa0", 'Major companies from a range of sectors are now looking to cut down on the amount of plastic they use.\xa0']

title: Buffett-backed BYD announces electric car partnership with Toyota
author: David Reid
points: ["Toyota Motor Corporation is to set up a joint venture with China's BYD Company.", 'The two companies want to design and build all-electric battery cars.', "BYD is 25% owned by Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway,"]

title: Massive wind turbine blade arrives in Massachusetts for testing
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['As technology develops, the size of wind turbines is increasing. ', 'GE Renewable Energy aims to commercialize its Haliade-X 12MW wind turbine by 2021']

title: AES and Google in 10-year tie up to push expansion of clean energy
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['The two firms say they want to speed up the expansion and adoption of clean energy.', 'Renewable sources of energy are becoming increasingly important cogs in the global energy mix.  ']

title: Thousands of scientists across the globe warn planet is 'facing a climate emergency'
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['The authors of the report highlight six areas where urgent action is required.', 'The paper will be troubling for many, but it does offer some hope for the future.']

title: Vietnam is pushing ahead of Southeast Asia in its drive for renewable energy
author: Grace Shao
points: ['Southeast Asia, long criticized for lagging behind in its efforts to adapt to more sustainable ways, is still heavily reliant on coal consumption.', 'Vietnam, however, has bold ambitions to use more renewable energy such as wind and solar.', "Global energy consultancy firm, Wood Mackenzie, said Vietnam is now the leader in Southeast Asia's solar photovoltaic  market and has the largest installed capacity in the region."]

title: Volkswagen starts factory production of electric car it says is 'accessible to millions'
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ["A ceremony held at Volkswagen's Zwickau plant was attended by CEO Herbert Diess and German Chancellor Angela Merkel.\xa0", "Some of the automotive industry's major players are now making moves in the electric vehicle sector."]

title: China does not need foreign tech or money to decarbonize, energy consultancy Wood Mackenzie says
author: Grace Shao
points: ['"Right now China\'s renewable energy sector is government driven. Going forward, it will be more economically driven," Mark Hutchinson, vice president of APAC power and renewables consulting at Wood Mackenzie.', "According to Wood Mackenzie, two of the world's top five wind turbine manufacturers are Chinese — and about 95% of those turbines are installed domestically.", "China is now the world's largest consumer of energy, the largest producer and consumer of coal, and the largest emitter of carbon dioxide, according to think tank China Power."]

title: Britain's biggest grocer is hoping to get rid of a billion pieces of plastic from its products
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['In order to achieve its targets, Tesco will be making changes to the way it packages and offers its products.\xa0', 'In attempting to reduce its use of plastic, Tesco joins other major firms such as Unilever.\xa0']

title: How algae could improve the air quality of our towns and cities
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ["Today's buildings use a wide range of technology to reduce their environmental impact.", 'With sustainability on the agenda of governments and businesses around the world, the way our built environment looks could be about to change.']

title: US wind energy capacity is now more than 100 gigawatts, according to new report
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['While the onshore wind market in the U.S. has undergone significant development, its offshore sector is still nascent.', 'The AWEA\'s "U.S. Wind Industry Third Quarter 2019 Market Report" was published on Thursday.\xa0']

title: Volkswagen faces a careful 'balancing act' to reach its electric future
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['Volkswagen is one of many major automobile firms making plays in the electric vehicle sector.', 'Others investing in electric mobility include Volvo Cars and the Hyundai Motor Group.\xa0']

title: Malaysia is targeting more renewables in its energy mix by 2025, environment minister says
author: Huileng Tan
points: ["Yeo Bee Yin, who is Malaysia's minister for energy, science, technology, environment and climate change said Malaysia is targeting to generate 20% of its electricity from renewable energy sources by 2025 — up from 2% currently.", 'Playing down the possibility of a carbon tax, Yeo suggested that solar energy is a viable option for Malaysia, a tropical country.']

title: Tesla chairwoman on Elon Musk's promises: Setting 'audacious goals' drives success
author: Michael Wayland
points: ['Tesla CEO Elon Musk\'s "audacious goals" have helped drive the company\'s success, Chairwoman Robyn Denholm says.', "Denholm cites Tesla's new factory in Shanghai that was built in 10 months and its recently achieved production of 97,000 vehicles a quarter as examples of such goals."]

title: Offshore wind set to be a $1 trillion business by 2040, the IEA says
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ["According to the IEA's Offshore Wind Outlook 2019, investment in the sector last year neared $20 billion, compared to under $8 billion in 2010.", 'A drop in costs, supportive governments and technological innovations will help to drive progress.']

title: In Finland, an 'intelligent' office could change the way people think about working
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['The buildings we work in can often resemble a second home, which is not always a good thing.\xa0', 'In Finland, one firm is developing technology it hopes will transform the way we work in offices.\xa0']

title: Ford unveiling 'Mustang-inspired' all-electric SUV in November
author: Michael Wayland
points: ['Ford Motor will unveil its "Mustang-inspired" all-electric SUV on Nov. 17.', 'The "performance SUV," according to Ford, will be available in U.S. and European dealerships next fall.', 'The vehicle is the first of what is expected to be an onslaught of all-electric vehicles as Ford invests $11.5 billion in all-electric and hybrid vehicles through 2022. ']

title: Amazon announces three new renewable energy projects, including its first in Scotland
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['Amazon\'s Director of Sustainability says the tech giant is "committed to minimizing our carbon emissions."\xa0', 'Amazon is one of many global firms looking to power operations using renewable sources of energy.']

title: Tesla's latest battle to win over Wall Street skeptics on the company's outlook
author: Tim Mullaney
points: ['Tesla will report third-quarter earnings after the close on Wednesday.', "Elon Musk's electric vehicle maker raised more than $2 billion in stocks and bonds earlier this year under new CFO Zachary Kirkhorn, but its stock is still down substantially in 2019.", 'Gross margin improvement and a bump in sales next year, to 450,000, will be key to Tesla shares having as much success as Musk and his new CFO had raising billions from the market.']

title: London's world-famous black cabs go green with launch of a fully electric vehicle
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ["Along with red double decker buses and the Tube, black cabs are an iconic part of London's transport infrastructure.", 'Central London is now home to an Ultra Low Emissions Zone, which operates 24-hours a day, seven days a week.']

title: Apple CEO Tim Cook says he's taking on climate change and needs backup
author: William Feuer
points: ['Apple received an award for its sustainability initiatives by Ceres, a nonprofit that promotes sustainable energy.', "Apple CEO Tim Cook spelled out Apple's stance on climate change in a speech accepting the award.", 'Cook called on fellow business leaders to adopt measures to combat climate change.']

title: Zero-emission cars in the UK could soon have green license plates
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ["It's hoped the introduction of the distinctive license plates will raise awareness of zero-emission transport options.\xa0", 'Green-colored plates are not a new idea and have been rolled out in places like Ontario, Canada.\xa0']

title: German start-up Lilium just got a step closer to making flying cars a reality
author: Ryan Browne
points: ['Lilium has announced completion of the first phase of testing on its five-seater air taxi, the Lilium Jet.', "It's also opened a new 3,000-square meter factory by its Munich headquarters and plans to build another one.", 'The firm hopes to eventually release a consumer-facing app that lets users hail the jet like they would an Uber.']

title: Mining giant BHP inks four renewable energy deals for Chilean copper sites
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['BHP says the deals will, from 2022, displace 3 million tonnes of carbon dioxide each year', 'The firm is one of several major mining companies turning to renewable source of energy to power operations.\xa0']

title: Renewable capacity set for 50% growth over next few years, IEA says
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['Increase will be driven by drops in cost and what the IEA describes as "concerted government policy efforts."', "Renewables' share in worldwide power generation is seen growing from 26% now to 30% in 2024."]

title: Electric vehicle prices finally in reach of millennial, Gen Z car buyers
author: Christopher Butler
points: ['The cost gap between electric vehicle models and traditional gas cars is beginning to shrink.', 'As the cost of lithium-ion batteries has gone down by over 70%, the gap in average transaction price between the Nissan LEAF and Nissan Maxima is closing.']

title: Electric car start-ups — once seen as threat — now struggle to survive
author: Paul A. Eisenstein
points: ['Since the beginning of the decade, a partial list of EV failures includes Bright Automotive, AMP, Aptera, Coda, Detroit Electric, Fisker Automotive and LeEco.', 'While some of the names on the list were seriously underfunded, others generated plenty of cash. ', 'Fisker, one of the most notable flame-outs, raised more than $2 billion in cash ']

title: Here's how a traditional boat helped inspire the sustainable features of a 2,000-seat opera house
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['Multinational firm Atkins is responsible for the design of Dubai Opera, which opened in 2016.', "The building's appearance is based on the traditional dhow boats used in the region."]

title: Toyota eyes former competitors as allies in electric car race
author: Paul A. Eisenstein
points: ['Toyota announced Aug. 28 it was acquiring a 4.94% stake in Suzuki for 96 billion yen, or $910 million. ', "The smaller automaker said it would purchase 0.2% of Toyota's outstanding shares for 48 billion yen, or about $455 million.", 'Toyota also holds a 5% stake in Mazda while the Hiroshima-based automaker has a 0.25% holding in the bigger company.']

title: US 'green economy' generates $1.3 trillion and employs millions, new study finds
author: Pippa Stevens
points: ['The "green economy" in America employs more than 9.5 million people, according to the University College London study.', 'The researchers compiled data from subsections of the broader economy such as electric vehicles, waste management and renewable energy.', "Measuring the green economy's impact in the United States is difficult because the government doesn't collect official data."]

title: Energy firm backed by Warren Buffett to build a $150 million wind farm in Canada
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['Construction work on the\xa0Rattlesnake Ridge Wind project will start next year.\xa0', "While oil is a significant cog in Alberta's economy, renewable energy projects are also being developed there."]

title: Geothermal project gets green light in UK after securing $21 million in funding
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['The well will be used to provide heat to parts of the Eden Project site in Cornwall.\xa0', 'The U.S. Department of Energy described geothermal energy as a "vital, clean energy resource." ']

title: Harley-Davidson halts production of new electric motorcycles
author: Mallika Mitra
points: ['Harley-Davidson has suspended production and deliveries of its new all-electric motorcycle after discovering a problem with its charging mechanism.', 'The motorcycle maker began previewing the LiveWire Electric Motorcycle last year in the U.S. and Europe.', "It's trying to draw in new customers with an all-electric bike. "]

title: How a massive Amazon wind farm promises to change a tiny town in rural America
author: Jacob Douglas
points: ['Amazon announced three new wind farm projects in April 2019 as part of their goal to become net-zero carbon emissions by 2040.', 'Large wind and solar farms create economic booms for rural communities.', 'Even after an initial construction boom, there is room for business growth.']

title: Brewer Carlsberg wants to produce a 'paper bottle' for its beer
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['Carlsberg is one of many major international firms looking to change the way it packages products.', 'Earlier this week consumer goods giant Unilever said it would halve its use of virgin plastic by 2025. ']

title: If PG&E now has power to shut you down, it is time to take control of your energy needs
author: Eric Rosenbaum
points: ['Solar power, energy storage and microgrid technology give homeowners and other energy consumers more ability to control their own power-generation needs.', 'As PG&E shuts down power to millions of energy users across California to prevent wildfires, energy consumers need to do better than complain and act helpless.', 'In an era of climate change and increasing wildfires, being able to get off the grid is important.']

title: Trump's pledge to save US coal is failing, leaving coal country in crisis
author: Scott Cohn
points: ["No state is harder hit by the coal slump in the U.S. than Wyoming, the nation's largest coal producer, accounting for more than 40% of the nation's output.", 'Coal production statewide through the first half of this year is down 30% from the same period five years ago, according to the Wyoming State Geological Survey.', 'A wave of layoffs and bankruptcies has the state searching for new uses and new markets for its most abundant mineral resource.']

title: Unilever says it wants to halve its use of 'virgin' plastic by 2025
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ["Unilever's brands include Dove, Ben & Jerry's and Lipton.", 'It wants to reduce the amount of plastics it uses.\xa0']

title: Solar power can boost your home's value — especially in these 10 states
author: Valentina Sanchez
points: ["Solar rooftop panels can boost your home's value and lower an electricity bill.", 'Real estate information provider Zillow found that New Jersey, Pennsylvania and North Carolina offer the highest solar premiums in the country.', 'California became the first state in the U.S. to require all new homes to have solar panels on their roofs starting in 2020.']

title: Scottish government says no to fracking as it confirms policy position
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['Scotland\'s energy minister says the development of onshore\xa0unconventional oil and gas is "incompatible with our policies on climate change."', 'The Scottish government will not issue licenses for new unconventional oil and gas developments.']

title: Russia can help India to be less dependent on oil, says Indian energy minister
author: Yen Nee Lee
points: ['India and Russia last month announced several deals relating to the energy sector.', "Those deals could help India, the world's third-largest oil consumer and importer, to reduce its reliance on oil, said Indian Minister of Petroleum and Natural Gas Dharmendra Pradhan.", "Diversifying India's energy mix allows the government to better manage its finances, according to Pradhan, who's also the country's steel minister. "]

title: Solar is back with an ETF tracking the sector up more than 50% this year
author: Pippa Stevens
points: ['Solar stocks are soaring as the broader energy sector struggles to hold onto its gain for the year.', "Invesco's Solar ETF has returned more than 50% this year, boosted by a tax credit that's about to expire, higher oil prices and solid fundamentals.", 'Top performers within the ETF include Enphase Energy, SolarEdge Technologies and SunPower.']

title: Climate protesters spray 1,800 liters of 'fake blood' over UK Treasury building
author: David Reid
points: ['Extinction rebellion activists have targeted the U.K. Treasury building in London.', 'Protesters say the U.K. is hypocritical to fund fossil fuel discoveries while claiming it is tackling climate change.']

title: Tesla delivers a record 97,000 vehicles in third quarter, falling short of forecasts
author: Michael Wayland
points: ['Tesla says it delivered 79,600 Model 3 cars and 17,400 Model S and X vehicles during the third quarter.', 'Musk previously predicted Tesla would deliver between 360,000 and 400,000 vehicles this year.', 'That target remains possible if the company can hit 105,000 vehicle deliveries in the fourth quarter.']

title: This Scottish company wants to develop tidal power in Canadian waters
author: Anmar Frangoul
points: ['Tidal power has been around for decades but the last few years have seen a number of new projects take shape. ', " If Nova Innovation's project gets the go-ahead, the array will be installed in several phases, starting in 2020."]

title: ConEd CEO explains how utility stocks react to interest rates — It's 'a knife that cuts both ways'
author: Tyler Clifford
points: ['Consolidated Edison CEO John McAvoy tells CNBC\'s Jim Cramer that interest rates are "a knife that cuts both ways."', '"We benefit as a sector as interest rates go down. We get hurt on the other end as interest rates come up," he says in an interview.', '"We worked to make sure that all of our investments are optimized to the value in customers and adopt things like solar panels, battery storage, electric vehicles and energy efficiency," he says.']

title: Drone company makes first-of-its-kind FAA-approved 'blind' drone flight
author: Jacob Douglas
points: ['The first FAA-approved long-distance drone flight using no ground-based radar or visual observer took place recently in Kansas.', 'The flight is a step toward making commercial drone flights routine across the U.S.', 'Iris Automation, which created the onboard drone collision-avoidance system, said routine flights may happen in a matter of months.']

title: Warming climate, population sprawl threaten California's future with more destructive wildfires
author: John W. Schoen
points: ['California’s major wildfires have been contained, but the threat of bigger and more destructive blazes is still on the horizon.', 'Climate change is exacerbating the chance of bigger wildfires in California, drying out vegetation that serves as fuel for devastating firestorms.', 'As humans leave cities and encroach into the forests and wildlands of California, the risk of bigger and more destructive fire increases.']

author: Grace Shao
points: ['"Right now China\'s renewable energy sector is government driven. title: $128 billion and growing: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway cash puzzle
author: Eric Rosenbaum
points: ["Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has seen its cash and short-term investments rise from roughly $23 billion in 2009 to $128 billion reported in its third-quarter earnings report Saturday morning.", 'This week California Governor Gavin Newsom practically pleaded with Buffett to buy embattled utility PG&E.', 'Buffett has previously denied any interest in PG&E, but utilities are a good sector for Berkshire cash. The problem: utilities are trading at all-time high stock prices.']

title: Race for 5G heats up: China's next-generation networks go online for as low as $18
author: Arjun Kharpal
points: ['China turned on its 5G networks ahead of schedule on Friday, after initially targeting a 2020 launch.', 'China Telecom, China Unicom and China Mobile all unveiled 5G tariffs that start at around 128 yuan or $18 per month.', 'Experts warned of a number of challenges to adoption including a lack of 5G capable handsets and tariffs being too expensive.', 'China and the U.S. are locked in an ongoing trade war that has also turned into a battle over technological supremacy. 5G is one of the key battlegrounds.']

title: Silicon Valley congressman: California should take control of PG&E as wildfire blackouts persist
author: Jessica Bursztynsky
points: ['"I would have them as a public utility," says\xa0California Rep. Ro Khanna,\xa0a Democrat whose district spans Silicon Valley.', '"When you have a state that has Apple, Google and Tesla in it, there is no excuse that we can\'t get power to our people on a regular basis," says\xa0Khanna.', 'PG&E was switching power off again Tuesday\xa0— this time, to about 1.5 million people in 29 Northern California counties — as wildfires ravage parts of the state. ']

title: New wildfire threatens thousands in LA as hurricane-force winds spread California blazes
author: Elly Cosgrove
points: ['A new wildfire breaks out in Los Angeles and blazes fanned by high wind spread elsewhere in California, a day after Gov. Gavin Newsom declared a statewide emergency.', 'Planned utility shutoffs left millions without power.', 'The California Department of Forestry & Fire Protection says 162,693 acres burned, 406 structures were damaged or destroyed, and three people have died .', 'The Kincade Fire in Sonoma County, the largest of the fires burning in the state, has spread to more than 66,000 acres.']

title: 'There are lives at stake': PG&E criticized over blackouts to prevent California wildfires
author: Emma Newburger
points: ['Pacific Gas & Electric cut off electricity to 179,000 customers in California in the face of a new wildfire threat.', 'Southern California Edison also warned of power outages to 308,000 customers.', 'Preemptive outages have come under deep criticism by those who argue that the blackouts threaten lives and local response efforts to fire emergencies, and shift responsibility from the company to the public.', "Utility equipment has been blamed in the last several years for some of California's most destructive wildfires."]

title: If PG&E now has power to shut you down, it is time to take control of your energy needs
author: Eric Rosenbaum
points: ['Solar power, energy storage and microgrid technology give homeowners and other energy consumers more ability to control their own power-generation needs.', 'As PG&E shuts down power to millions of energy users across California to prevent wildfires, energy consumers need to do better than complain and act helpless.', 'In an era of climate change and increasing wildfires, being able to get off the grid is important.']

title: PG&E power outage could cost the California economy more than $2 billion
author: Pippa Stevens
points: ['In an unprecedented move, PG&E enacted large-scale power cuts in Northern and central California as a preventative measure aimed at curbing wildfires.', "In January, PG&E filed for bankruptcy protection, saying it's facing more than $30 billion in liabilities after it was determined that its power lines sparked last year's devastating Camp Fire. "]

title: Facing slowing growth and credit downgrades, South Africa's economy is stuck in the mire
author: Elliot Smith
points: ['The World Bank has cut South Africa’s growth forecast for 2019 through to 2021, citing weak investor sentiment and lingering policy uncertainty. ', 'Growth for 2019 is now projected at 0.8%, half a percentage point lower than April’s forecast and unchanged from 2018, according to the bank’s October Africa’s Pulse report.', 'The Absa Manufacturing PMI dipped to 41.6 in September from 25.7 in August, the second consecutive sharp decline in factory activity and South Africa’s largest in a decade.']

title: Trump's pledge to save US coal is failing, leaving coal country in crisis

title: The future of the US wireless industry in limbo as T-Mobile and Sprint begin battle to win merger approval
author: Alex Sherman
points: ['T-Mobile and Sprint are set to begin arguing their case to merge against state attorney generals in Manhattan on Monday.', "The No. 3 and No. 4 U.S. wireless providers plan to argue there's more competition than just four carriers in today's market and the importance of accelerating 5G technology by merging assets.", 'If a deal is blocked, other companies are likely to make attempts at merging with or acquiring T-Mobile, Sprint, or both, sources say.']

title: Citigroup is raising its stock forecast for 2020 despite election year uncertainty
author: Emma Newburger
points: ['Citi raised its year-end 2020 S&P 500 target slightly to 3,375 from 3,300 because of the better gains this year versus its 3,050 objective for 2019.', 'The bank cautioned, however, that higher taxes and tighter regulation are likely next year if the Democrats win the White House.', 'A Donald Trump re-election would bring its own risks of unpredictable policy on trade, diplomatic relations and global order, the bank wrote.\xa0', '"The elections backdrop remains a major uncertainty overhang, even though the last year of a presidential cycle tends to generate respectable returns," Citi wrote.']
